title: Want to get involved in eSports in OCE? Here is how you can.

replies.body:
Ha! Didnt even know this was coming out!

As an Org manager, and someone who has worked with Elam, I can attest to what he has written above.

Also nothing happens quickly. Elam enjoys a position of trust because he has been reliable OVER TIME, and was never about flashing around his connections.

Work hard, and like Sebbie, the new House Manager for Sin Gaming, positions will come to those who are patient. Sebbie was the House manager for X5 before that all went bust, but she waited it out, kept applying and working networks connections, and is still progressing her esports career and dream.

There are plenty of volunteer, and increasingly to some extent, paid positions in Australian esports. Just be prepared to put in a few years!

This is a fantastic post!

Passionate fans who want to contribute are a huge part of all esports teams.

You could say the same about AFL or NRL teams not so long ago. It was the passionate fans who volunteered their time for the club who helped make them what they are. 

If you're passionate about esports reach out to your favourite team. They'd be happy to have the help!

Thank you means a lot coming from you mate and I 100% agree with the points you brought up!

I'm really excited to watch and be a part of eSports as it evolves in OCE as we have so many exciting things that already happened this year, and I feel like there is more to come :D

~Elam

My issue is I have no experience in the industry 

All I have is my countless hours of working alongside little teams that needed help with scrims/strats/or just a place to practice 

But I would love to hear more about how those with little experience in the industry can make their way into the esports scene :)
